intro: Kobresia buchananii, commonly known as the Buchanan's sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. The plant plays a role in stabilizing soil and preventing erosion in its native habitats. Its morphology reflects evolutionary adaptations to survive in nutrient-poor and water-scarce environments.
